attributes.additional_details:
This day centre is for elderly people with all kinds of different needs. It helps family's with respite care, and is there for people that have no help around them and for people to have their independence and to have friends in a place they can go to.
Please sign the petition to help keep our centre open it really does make a huge difference to alot of people's lives.
attributes.background: The centre, in Morleston Street, Derby, provides social activities like reminiscence sessions, arts and crafts, a hot meal, entertainment and exercise for the elderly

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Morleston Day Centre is the responsibility of Derby City Council.

If you reside in Derby, you could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Derby City Council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here: http://www.derby.gov.uk/council-and-democracy/consultations/petitions/
